name: La Mecánica Popular LP
description: Artist: La Mecánica Popular Title: La Mecánica Popular Format: Vinyl LP Speed: 33 RPM On the heels of a steady rising, break out year in New York City, which has seen La Mecanica Popular perform & refine their "Psychedelic Salsa" sound in numerous venues throughout the area, as well as advance to become one of just 3 national finalists in Dewar's "Dewaristas: The Search for the Next Great Latin Sound," Names You Can Trust presents their debut long-player to a worldwide audience for the first time. Led off by the lead single and official video which dropped earlier in the year on NYCT, La Paz Del Freak, the album weaves it's way around the traditional stylings of Salsa & Bolero, with a heavy dose of electrico, incorporating a blend of Peruvian guitars & experimental synths, sounds and textures. They've been praised for their live performances and recordings alike, receiving endorsments and spins from notables such as Juanes, Quantic, Gilles Peterson & Bobbito to name a few. The 9-track album of original compositions was recorded between NYC & Peru, written by band-leader Efrain Rozas and co-produced alongside Xuxi Lazzaro (Rita Indiana) & Manuel Garcia Orozco. Feautring a melting pot of musicians from New York, Colombia, Peru & Venezuela, as well as the core 8-piece ensemble that performs live, this debut album serves as a welcome connection between the roots, rhythms, and future possibilities of Tropical music and culture. A1 : La Paz Del Freak A2 : Ella Le Decia A3 : Guajiro A4 : Se Que Me Olvidaste B1 : Arbol B2 : Muy Distinto B3 : Milagro B4 : La Tragaespadas B5 : Se Que Me Olvidaste - Alternate Version LISTEN

name: Sound Of Cape Verde EP
description: Artist: Various Title: Sound Of Cape Verde EP (O Son De Cabo Verde EP) Format: 12" EP Speed: 45 RPM New Sofrito Island Series just landed! This is a dangerous piece of wax. as the crew journeys into the sound of Cape Verde, a tiny Island cluster off the coast of West Africa. Blazing uptempo business as usual but there's a unique flare and substance to the Cabo Verde vibe. Needless to say these 3 selections are primed to implode on a dance, featuring an edit from Alma Negro (check out his mix of Cape Verde tunes on the Sofrito site and watch yourself crawl deeper into the rabbit hole) as well as Hide & Smile, the duo comprised of Sofrito's Frankie Francis & Soundway's Miles Cleret. Sureshot. A1 : Dionisio Maio - Corpim Sabe (Alma Negra Edit) B1 : Bulimundo - Santo Antòni La Belèm (Hide & Smile Edit) B2 : Os Kings - Minino Na Tchora LISTEN

name: Jungle Magic
description: Artist: Benis Cletin Title: Jungle Magic Format: 12" Speed: 45 RPM More Sofrito Super Singles back in stock! Maybe one of the tuffest singles they've put out and that's saying something. Heavy Heavy Nigerian Disco madness with some serious space appeal. More Fire! A1 : Benis Cletin - Jungle Magic (Sofrito Edit) B1 : Money Make Man Mad (Sofrito Disco Dub) LISTEN

name: Benin City Grooves
description: Artist: Various Title: Benin City Grooves Format: 12" Speed: 45 RPM More Sofrito Super Singles back in stock! Benin City Grooves is a devastating slow-bubbling double dip of nasty from Benin, treated lovingly and carefully for the dance by top slicers Frankie Francis & Simbad. More of that automatic fire from Sofrito. A1 : Sir Victor Uwaifo - Ohue (Frankie Francis & Simbad Edit) B1 : Sonny Okosun - Odenigbo (Frankie Francis & Simbad Edit) LISTEN

name: Stephen Encinas - Disco Illusion
description: Artist: Stephen Encinas Title: Disco Illusion Format: 12" Single Speed: 45 RPM Invisible City Editions returns with another resurrected Trinidadian monster disco holy grail, this time tapping Stephen Encinas' Disco Illusion off Kalinda records. Epic extended Island grooves that'll keep you locked in tight as soon as the needle drops. This is as guaranteed a sure shot as they come!! A1 : Disco Illusion B1 : Lypso Illusion LISTEN

name: Proh Mic - Right On Time
description: Artist: Proh Mic Title: Right On Time Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM More Cherries for that record box, as the Chicago rooted, now NY-based label continues to handpick a selector's choice of sweet slices of present day Funk & R&B. This time around, Seattle's Proh Mic delivers two absolute deadly doses of quality Modern biz! Get it! A1 : Right On Time B1 : I Like LISTEN

name: Lord Echo - Curiosities LP
description: Artist: Lord Echo Title: Curiosities Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM New Zealand's Lord Echo has arrived with his much-anticipated sophomore album entitled Curiosities. Following on the heels on his wonderfully received Melodies debut a few years back, Curiosities invokes a similar meditation on different styles, grooves and feelings. Don't try to pigeon hole this release to any particular genre. An advanced listen will pinpoint a world of different inspirations and influences throughout. But it's pretty clear that this record is a beautiful example of original music (save for the Pharaoh Sanders cover) and fantastic production technique. Believe that. A1 : Endless Dawn A2 : Bohemian Idol A3 : Digital Haircut A4 : Street Knowledge A5 : Molten Lava B1 : Put It In My Head B2 : The Creator Has A Master Plan B3 : Ghost Hands B4 : What Is The Feeling B5 : Arabesque LISTEN

name: Raw Silk Volume One
description: Artist: Various Title: Raw Silk Volume One Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM Omega Supreme Records returns with a juicy little EP showcasing some of the flyest and silkiest modern music out there. Guaranteed nuff "That's my JAM!" type jams throughout. K-Maxx, Sasac, Benedek, Turquoise Summers and more. It's dope, so we got it. A1 : K-Maxx - Wanna Play Hooky A2 : Bus Crates 16 Bit Ensemble - In Gear A3 : Toni Clarke - Let's Do It A4 : East Liberty Quarters - The 206 B1 : Sasac - Spring Jam B2 : Benedek - Saturday Jam B3 : Henning - Peak Of Summer B4 : Turquoise Summers - All Over Again LISTEN

name: The Far East - Youthman
description: Artist: The Far East Title: Youthman Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Debut release from Brooklyn's The Far East on the new Tea Factory Sounds imprint. Throwback Rock Steady Roots production produced by Brett Tubin, laid effortlessly underneath the lovely vocals of singer Maddie Ruthless. Top notch recording in the raw, fabulous Version on the flip and and personal hand stamped labels to boot. Reggae Special status. A1 : Youthman B1 : Version LISTEN

name: Conjunto Papa Upa - Vintage Voudou
description: Artist: Conjunto Papa Upa Title: Vintage Voudou Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Debut recording from Conjunto Papa Upa and Alex Figueira. Monster Afro-Venezuelan-Caribbean inspired tunes with deep soulful rhythms and seductive squelchy melodies. Sounds like a lost meeting between Nelson & Les Guitares Boys in Luanda. Killer! A1 : Vintage Voudou B1 : Camuri Chico LISTEN

name: Fumaça Preta - A Bruxa
description: Artist: Fumaça Preta Title: A Bruxa Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Raw Psychedelic Sounds from Fumaça Preta on Music With Soul! Truly bugged-out vintage stylings, recapturing an "almost-lost-but-still-out-there" Brazilian Fuzz movement featuring Tropicalia In Furs' Joel Stones, Stuart Carter, James Porch & Alex Figueira on an improvisational bender in their Barracao Sound Studios in the Netherlands. A1 : A Bruxa B1 : Loco LISTEN

name: G-Flux - Ritmo Universal
description: Artist: G-Flux Title: Ritmo Universal Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Monster digital Cumbia from Mexico City by way of Washington D.C. producer G-Flux. How you want it you got it, thumping slo-mo cumbiatronic beats on the front accompanied by Los Master Plus's spaced out vocals, flip side upside with a juicy slice of chicha featuring Afrodita on vocals & Pervuvian guitar legend, Jose Luis Carballo. A1 : Ritmo Universal (Feat. Los Master Plus) B1 : Meneito (Feat. Afrodita & Jose Luis Carballo) LISTEN

name: Tempo Dreams Vol. 2
description: Artist: Various Title: Teeko & B. Bravo present Tempo Dreams Vol. 2 Format: 2LP Speed: 33 RPM Bastard Jazz returns with their second installment of the Tempo Dreams compilation series, this time tapping Bay Area producers Teeko & B. Bravo for another round of future beats & soul. There's an ill approach to this whole project and it comes across in the quality of 'off the beaten path' tunes, featuring a healthy nugget of Modern Funk delights from the likes of K-Maxx, Starship Connection, Rojai & E-Live, but ultimately the compilation lives in it's own atmosphere, it's own niche...and that's a good thing. It's new and it's dope and that's all you need to know. A1 : S3 - Don't Stop A2 : Rojai & E-Live - Hard Pressed A3 : Pomrad - Dans B1 : Starship Connection - We Can Go All Night B2 : Mugpush ft. Black Spade - Came Too Far C1 : K-Maxx - Dreamin' Of You C2 : Tony Ozier - Back To The Mitten C3 : Bayonics - Wheels Keep Turning (Remix) D1 : Atjazz ft. Amalia - One D2 : Insomaniax - A Vibe For Chrissy D3 : Approach - While Seated / She Burned LISTEN

name: Guinea Folk Remixed Vol. 1
description: Artist: Various Title: Guinea FOlk Remixed Vol. 1 Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Two Volume 45 Set (Sold Separately) from Stronghold Sound delivers 4 remixes off their Sembeh Ma Fa Fe compilation. Large, futuristic dance explorations on both volumes, including Captain Planet & Gikau + Boima on Vol. 1. A1 : Tounkan - Sara (Captain Planet Remix) B1 : Sida - Mybaby (Giku + Boima Remix) LISTEN

name: Guinea Folk Remixed Vol. 2
description: Artist: Various Title: Guinea Folk Remixed Vol. 2 Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Two Volume 45 Set (Sold Separately) from Stronghold Sound delivers 4 remixes off their Sembeh Ma Fa Fe compilation. Large, futuristic dance explorations on both volumes, including J-Boogie & Dub Snakkr on Vol. 2. A1 : Sida - Mybaby (J-Boogie Remix) B1 : Sida - Mybaby (Dub Snakkr Remix) LISTEN

name: Rock With U / El Mensaje
description: Artist: Various Title: Rock With U / El Mensaje Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM 3rd release from Danny Holloway's Ximeno label. Super limited press of 300, and knowing that the first 2 releases came and went with the quickness, be on it! For the 3rd installment we get another double dip, a nasty reggae rework of MJ's Rock With You, backed with the elusive LP only cover of Cymande's The Message from El Salvador's Hielo Ardiente. Nice double sider! A1 : Mike The Glove - Rock With U B1 : Hielo Ardiente - El Mensaje LISTEN

name: Brukky - Why Yu Nuh
description: Artist: Brukky Title: Why Yu Nuh Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Pure '80s dancehall niceness from Names You Can Trust! Your ears may tell you this is a vintage Jammy's release or a lost Barry Brown classic, but this irresistible bubbler comes straight from the hotbed of Brooklyn's roots scene, with production by Victor “Ticklah” Axelrod and vocals by the honey-voiced Brukky, taking time off from his main job as lead singer of Rock Steady revivalists the Frightnrs. An effervescent dub version, eye-grabbing labels and a custom-printed paper sleeve complete another essential release in the NYCT catalog. A1 : Why Yu Nuh B1 : Version LISTEN

name: Brukky - Why Yu Nuh (Pre-Release)
description: Artist: Brukky Title: Why Yu Nuh Format: 7" Pre-Release Speed: 45 RPM NYCT's upcoming new single produced by Ticklah featuring lead singer from The Frightnrs, Brukky!! Exclusive NYCT official Pre-Release press. Just for you. Run Come. A1 : Why Yu Nuh B1 : Version LISTEN

name: M.A.K.U - Music Never Dies EP
description: Artist: M.A.K.U Soundsystem Title: Music Never DIes Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM New York-Based M.A.K.U Soundsystem's self released & debut EP featuring 4 original compositions. These guys have been hard at work around the New York City, recording, playing shows...furthering the blend of Afro-Colombian roots, futuristic punk rock & a raw home grown DIY aesthetic. Flavor! A1 : La Tomba A2 : MND (Music Never Dies) B1 : Womyn B2 : El Jugo LISTEN

name: Nite Class - Love Scenes LP
description: Artist: Nite Class Title: Love Scenes Formaat: LP Speed: 33 RPM More goods in the burgeoning Modern-Funk landscape from Nite Class on Hot Shot Records. Proper mid 80's R&B dance-floor vibes produced by Benny Badge. 3 vocals along with 3 original instrumentals. Fly synthesizer moods straight from time warp. A1 : What's On Your Mind A2 : Stay The Nite A3 : Find A Way (To You) B1 : Serious B2 : Love Scenes B3 : Call You Mine LISTEN

name: Sasac - Ultra LP
description: Artist: Sasac Title: Ultra Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Omega Supreme Records and Sasac return with more Intergalatic, Modern-Funk waves. Another stellar long-player (see Turquoise Summers) that rides slow and steady from beginning to end. Stockholm-native Sasac keeps it silky and atmospheric, straddling the line between early-80s private press recall and futuristic spaceship jump off. Glide. Limited 500 copies worldwide. A1 : From Telemark To The Alhambra A2 : All Pleasures A3 : DMX! A4 : Retail Atmospherics #1 Service Encounter A5 : Tennis Courts A6 : The Dome B1 : Theme From Hit Supply B2 : Garden Sounds B3 : Flyers Pt. Duex B4 : Off-World Leisure Gardens B5 : Lonny Zone B6 : Warm Gold LISTEN

name: Swing-A-Ling Special Edition
description: Artist: Various Title: Swing-A-Ling Special Edition Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Special Edition Swing-A-Ling issue 45 to commemorate the Brooklyn Backyard BBQ function put on by Names You Can Trust. The first edition features 2 nasty, funky, Rock-Steady-Era instrumental burners from Duke Reid & Vin Gordon. Only 145 copies worldwide, hand-stamped, hand-numbered. Exclusively available at Independent Grand & Deadly Dragon Sound. A1 : Duke Of Soul B1 : Vin's Beat LISTEN

name: A Taste Of Tempo Dreams 2
description: Artist: Various Title: A Taste of Tempo Dreams 2 Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Lead single off the upcoming compilation Tempo Dreams Volume 2, which has been compiled by San Francisco producers B. Bravo & Teeko. This taster gives you an idea of what's to come. Futuristic Modern Funk with a California sense of style. Bastard Jazz plus the Bay. Good news for everybody. A1 : Starship Connection - We Can Go All Night B1 : K-Maxx - Dreamin Of You LISTEN

name: Los Pirañas - Salvemos Nuestro Folclor
description: Artist: Los Pirañas Title: Salvemos Nuestro Folclor Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM The 3-piece brainchild from the founders of Bogota's Frente Cumbiero, Meridian Brothers & Romperayo!! A truly Avant-Garde ensemble. Stripped down relentless rhythms and sounds in a punk-rock approach to Colombian roots and culture. Limited Edition pink vinyl press & hand-painted sleeves courtesy of Chicago's Alona's Dream Records. A1 : Salvemos Nuestro Folclor B1 : Carnavalito Infernal y Cosas Cheveres LISTEN

name: LascaMão - Rufar Dos Tamborins (Blue Vinyl)
description: Artist: LascaMão Title: Rufar Dos Tamborins Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Blue Vinyl. Limited Edition of 100. Names You Can Trust presents the International debut release of the Brazilian percussion ensemble LascaMão. Comprised of eight members including one of the true masters of Brazilian percussion, Robertinho Silva, the sound of the group is the fruit of several years researching the different rhythms and interactions of Brazil's rich musical influences. The result is a modern & heavy mix of Afro-Brazilian traditions created specifically for the dance, an invitation for your feet to travel throughout the sound of the drums and the texture of the voices. This sure-fire single lets the rhythms breath in full on both tracks, lead by the seductive timbre of the cuíca on Rufar Dos Tamborins, and the bubbling intensity of the vocal chants on Caminho De Minas. Another worthy and staple piece in your traveling record box from NYCT. A1 : Rufar Dos Tamborins B1 : Caminho De Minas LISTEN

name: Bondi Blaster - Salchichón Primavera
description: Artist: Bondi Blaster Title: Salchichón Primavera Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Digi-Cumbia madness from Stronghold Sound and Juan Data's Bondi Blaster. Two mixes of Salchichón Primavera. Boom sound. A1 : Salchichón Primavera (Sonido Caballero & Kay RMX) B1 : Salchichón Primavera (Sonidero Choridub) LISTEN

name: Funky Bompa Afro Edits
description: Artist: Funky Bompa Title: Funky Bompa Afro Edits Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Heavy edits from Funky Bompa for the 3rd in his Bompa Discos series. Sure Fire Afro Drums & High Life represented on this double sider. A most definite dance floor ignitor. Limited to 300 worldwide. A1 : Mesida - Funky Bompa Edit B1 : Yemana - Funky Bompa Edit LISTEN

name: Doug Shorts - Don't Sleep On My Love
description: Artist: Doug Shorts Title: Don't Sleep On My Love Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Cherries Records out of Chicago has put together a great string of debut 45 releases, honoring and forwarding the Modern Funk & R&B tradition with some fresh new recordings. Their 5th release, and second with Doug Shorts, is another fine example of brand new with a classic appeal. Silky. Milky. Don't sleep... A1 : Don't Sleep On My Love B1 : Bet I'll Know The Next Time LISTEN

name: Doc Delay - Morgan LP
description: Artist: Doc Delay Title: Morgan Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Piecelock 70 comes through with another well crafted, expertly cared for long-player package (check DJ Day's Land of a 1000 Chances & PUTS' Highlighter for more of that good). Custom spot-varnish on the front and back spelling out "Morgan" and 8-page booklet round out the details. Musically, Brooklyn-based producer Doc Delay strings together a really seductive and interesting listening experience, blurring the lines between live instrumentation and samples, drawing heavy inspiration from deep 60s/70s Psyche and crunchy Beats & Breaks. Go find Doc Delay's mix CD "REM Sleep" for a further journey into his reaches of Psychedelic records. This LP, much like that mixtape, respects the beginning and end, weaving in and out of vibes and stuff. Definitely one for the turntable. Listen. Flip. Listen. A1: Intro A2: Ten Indians A3: Daytime A4: Tourniquet A5: This Ring A6: Keepers A7: To The Wall B1: Walk Beside Me B2: Bully on Bogart B3: Owl Mountain B4: WTYO B5: Nominal B6: Last Bus Home B7: Ghostly Sun LISTEN

name: Private Function EP
description: Artist: Various Title: Private Function Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM Fresh new Modern Funk compilation from San Francisco's Voltaire Records. 4 bonafide examples of the increasingly prolific and exquisite movement of new music with a vintage-G-appeal. We ride with this whole EP. A1: XL Middleton & Eddie Funkster - Night Time Is Coming A2: K-Maxx - Da Blast B1: Night School - Speak Softly B2: Loose Shus - Loose Coupling LISTEN

name: Bio Ritmo - La Verdad LP
description: Artist: Bio Ritmo Title: La Verdad Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Got a few of the last remaining copies of Bio Ritmo's excellent LP on Electric Cowbell. Proper long-player all the way through. Grooves. Full Digital Download included plus bonus Remix from Greenwood Rhythm Coalition's E's E. A1: La Verdad A2: Dina's Mambo A3: La Muralla A4: Carnaval B1: Verguenza B2: Majadero B3: Caravan Del Vejigante B4: Lola's Dilemma LISTEN

name: Larry Nozero - Time 2LP
description: Artist: Larry Nozero Title: Time Formt: 2LP Speed: 33 RPM Amir's new 180 Proof imprint is in the midst of re-releasing and unearthing Detroit's Strata Records catalog. Remastered from the original tapes, spread across double vinyl and housed in supreme gatefold tip-on packaging. This, the 2nd release from 180 Proof, is the sought after Larry Nozero album. This is big boy jazz. Heavy moods and vibes from the heart of the rare groove era. Black vinyl version. Stamped numbered edition of 1000. A1: Reflections of My Past A2: Tony B1: Chronicle Of The Murdered House Part 1 B2: Chronicle Of The Murdered House Part 2 C1: Tune for L.N. C2: Impressions of My Lady D1: All The Things You Know D2: Two Worlds D3: Baubles, Bangles & Beads LISTEN

name: Erimaj - Conflict Of A Man
description: Arist: Erimaj Title: Conflict Of A Man Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Inaugural release from Akalepse's new imprint and Truth & Soul division, Plane Jane, featuring some proper newness from NYC's Erimaj, a full band blending chunky beats with a deft touch of soul and jazzy jazz. Familiar, yet refreshingly new and on point. Never sleep on a debut release! A1: Conflict Of A Man B1: Nothing Like This LISTEN

name: Nickodemus & Sammy Ayala - Baila a Tu Manera
description: Artist: Nickodemus Title: Baila a Tu Manera Format: 7" Speed: 33 RPM Here's a scorcher. Recorded in Puerto Rico by Nickodemus & Sammy Ayala and reworked by The Whiskey Barons. Steady, chugging and universal. Vocal & Instrumental. A1: Baila a Tu Manera (Whiskey Barons Remix) B1: Instrumental LISTEN

name: Colm K - The Love EP
description: Arist: Colm K Title: The Love EP Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM New EP from Ireland-based DJ & Producer Colm K and Bastard Jazz. 4 well crafted and thoughtful modern day beats & productions. A deft touch on the synthesizer and a dash a soul. True School, New School indeed. A1: The Attic (feat. Walshy) A2: Nothing B1: Good Fridays B2: Spaced (feat. Walshy) LISTEN

name: Moon B - Sussegad EP (Smoke Vinyl)
description: Artist: Moon B Title: Sussegad EP Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM More throwback drum machine soul from PPU. Moon B follows up his 'test pressing' release on PPU with more classic era lo-fi esoteric synth music, recorded live earlier in 2013 and pressed on smoked gray vinyl. Sharp! A1: Oof B1: Sussegad B2: Popular LISTEN

name: Uku Kuut - PPU Test Pressing
description: Artist: Uku Kuut Title: PPU Test Pressing Format: 12" Speed: 33 RPM What goes around comes back around again! PPU knows this as well as any label out there, bringing back some summery Southern Californian synthesizer soul from Uku Kuut for #2 in their 'test pressing' series. Previously unreleased but recorded in 1995 while UK was living in Santa Monica, these are two honest and laid back examples of drum machine soul on ice. A1: I Feel Love B1: Santa Monica Pier LISTEN

name: Very Be Careful - El Millonario
description: Artist: Very Be Careful Title: El Millonario Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Los Angeles veterans Very Be Careful have released a ton of top notch traditional Cumbia Vallenato since the late 90s. Their latest single released on Steady Beat Recordings is no different – think Velasquez, Landero as inspiration, and a burning dance floor of accordion fire. A1: El Millonario B1: El Encuentro LISTEN

name: Los Bullets - Crystal Organ
description: Artist: Los Bullets Title : Crystal Organ Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Latino Reggae Soul special from Southern California and Steady Beat Recordings. Back-to-Back scorchas in an organ instrumental style for your Rock Steady love. Top! A1: Crystal Organ B1: Gunshot LISTEN

name: Michael Boothman - Waiting For Your Love
description: Artist: Michael Boothman Title: Waiting For Your Love Format: 12" Speed: 45 RPM This legendary Caribbean Disco and supremely sought after and valuable piece from Trinidad gets the proper treatment from Invisible City Editions! Two bonafide body movers including an epic rendition of the Bobby Caldwell classic. Mixed and Mastered from the original 2" tapes. This is that joint. A1: Waiting For Your Love B1: What You Won't Do For Love LISTEN

name: Chico Mann - Magical Thinking 2LP
description: Artist: Chico Mann Title: Magical Thinking Format: 2LP Speed: 33 RPM Chico Mann's first full-length release on Soundway Records does not disappoint! It's quite an evolution from his first work on Manifest Tone but it all makes sense. Diving deeper in electro territory, the sound on this album is big and lush, yet still maintains that seductive blend and influence of Antibalas rhythm guitar and mid-80s New York dance music. Playable joints all over this piece front to back, plus a too nice cover by Alvaro Tapia Hidalgo. A1: Comes and Goes A2: Long Time Gone A3: Estrellitas (Little Stars) B1: Edge of It B2: Same Old Clown B3: Magic Touch B4: I Feel It C1: Esta Bueno C2: Vengo A Ti C3: Vivito (El Colibri) D1: One Day Late D2: Done Waiting D3: Wake Up Soon D4: Oye Mira LISTEN

name: Chico Mann - Same Old Clown EP
description: Artist: Chico Mann Title: Same Old Clown Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM Lead EP in support of Chico Mann's full-length on Soundway (Magical Thinking). Original Album Version features Kendra Morris (Wax Poetics) on vocals. This is everybody on the dance-floor type music! Proper 12" setting with 2 mixes that manage to elevate the original with high-grade production from Linkwood and Kon. Check out Kon's Dub for some serious night time vibes. A1: Album Version A2: Linkwood Remix B1: Kon Remix B2: Kon Dub LISTEN

name: Ondatropica - Punkero Sonidero
description: Artist: Ondatropica Title: Punkero Sonidero Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM The 1st 7" release from Will Holland & Mario Galeano's Ondatropica project recorded at the legendary Discos Fuentes Studio in Medellín, Colombia. 2 absolute burners including the amazing Black Sabbath cover. This defines essential material. A1: Punkero Sonidero B1: Iron Man LISTEN

name: Meridian Brothers - Purple Haze
description: Artist: Meridian Brothers Title: Niebla Morada (Purple Haze) Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Wow! Bogotá's Meridian Brothers cook up a truly trippy rendition of Jimi Hendrix's Purple Haze in their signature and truly unique vibe. Sped up vocals and bugged out keyboard riffs from Eblis Alvarez play the familar parts. A definite head turner! B-Side provides a new original composition from the band. A1: Neibla Morada (Purple Haze) B1: Juego Traicion LISTEN

name: La Mecánica Popular - La Paz Del Freak (Clear Vinyl)
description: Artist: La Mecánica Popular Title: La Paz Del Freak Format: 7" Clear Vinyl Speed: 45 RPM Clear Vinyl Independent Grand Exclusive! 100 Copies only. A mixture of Peruvian, Colombian and New York musicians, La Mecánica Popular is part of the new wave of tropical music. Steeped in the roots of 1970's era salsa dura and heavily influenced by the psychedelic experimental sounds of Peru, the band's first vinyl single on Names You Can Trust provides two original compositions with a proper dose of ambience and hard rhythms. A1: La Paz Del Freak B1: Guajiro LISTEN

name: Grupo Los Yoyi LP
description: Artist: Grupo Los Yoyi Title: Grupo Los Yoyi Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Legendary Afro-Cuban record from Grupo Los Yoyi! Heavy Funk, Jazz & Psyche influences on this beast. One of the more sought after pieces from the Egrem archives, truly a very difficult record to find. Luckily the good folks at Black Pearl Records in Germany have given it the proper reissue treatment. Officially licensed and remastered from the original tapes, this package looks and sounds the part. Top notch quality thru and thru. Limited to 500 copies worldwide. A1: Banana A2: Del Copacabana a 34 A3: Mi Pequeño Gran Paolo A4: Paco La Calle A5: Tu No Me Puedes Conquistar B1: Yo, Mejor Te Doy B2: Ruta 30 B3: Abuela Tula B4: El Fino LISTEN

name: Cheick Hamala Diabate - Prudence EP
description: Artist: Cheick Hamala Diabate Title: Prudence Format: 12" EP Speed: 33 RPM Master Grito and Ngoni player Cheick Hamala of Mali gets the remix treatment from a very nice range of producers including E's E, Whiskey Barons & Jon Kennedy. A1: Prudence - E's E Remix A2: Prudence - Whiskey Barons Remix A3: Prudence - Jon Kennedy Remix B1: Prudence - Daytoner Remix B2: Prudence - Original B3: Fatou Kounkoun Sissoko - Sol Power All Stars Remix LISTEN

name: Turquoise Summers - A Touch Of Turquoise LP
description: Artist: Turquoise Summers Title: A Touch Of Turquoise Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Some serious intergalactic sounds from Cali's Turquoise Summers and Omega Supreme Records. Pure golden sunshine from drop to stop. Another impressive modern funk gem out of Southern Cali-land. 500 copies worldwide. Stunner. A1: The Touch A2: The Thrill A3: Divinity A4: Don't Break My Heart A5: Stardust A6: Stage 2 B1: Phase Shiftin B2: Night Shades B3: Cuando Tocamos B4: The Smile On Your Face B5: Just To Show You I Mean Business LISTEN

name: Los Hacheros - Pilon LP
description: Artist: Los Hacheros Title: Pilon Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Beautiful Salsa / Charanga vibes from this newly formed NY-based band. Heavy sounds in a traditional style! MP3 Download Card included. A1: Azucar A2: Desastre A3: Chano A4: Papote's Guajira B1: Convergencia B2: Pilon B3: Tintorera B4: Mami Me Gusto B5: Cha-Cha Herzlia LISTEN

name: Tommy Stewart's Disco Love Affair 2LP
description: Artist: Tommy Stewart Title: Disco Love Affair Format: 2LP Speed: 33 RPM Another essential reissue package from Cultures Of Soul featuring 14 supreme late 70s Cosmic Funk cuts from Atlanta-based producer Tommy Stewart and 2 must-have mixes from legendary DJ/Remixer Al Kent. A1: Stevo - Pay The Price A2: Stevo - Universal Love Affair A3: Stevo - Party Night A4: Stevo - Starry Eyes B1: Stevo - Messing Up A Good Thing B2: Stevo - Jammin B3: Stevo - Livin For The City B4: Stevo - Save The World C1: Tommy Stewart - Hot Box C2: Tommy Stewart - Everything's Made For Love C3: Tommy Stewart - Night Flight C4: Tommy Stewart - Beyond Love D1: Stevo - Jammin (Al Kent Remix) D2: Tommy Stewart - Beyond Love (Al Kent Edit) LISTEN

description: Artist: Evans Pyramid Title: Evans Pyramid Format: Gatefold LP Speed: 33 RPM The very elusive Evans Pyramid singles reissued and remastered for the first time in a beautiful gatefold LP package. Blissful Disco-Funk masterpieces recorded from 1978-80 by Andre Evans. name: Tall Black Presents Tempo Dreams Vol. 1
description: Artist: Various Title: Tall Black Guy Presents Tempo Dreams Vol. 1 Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM A progressive and forward thinking beat compilation as put together by Tall Black Guy. Give it up to Bastard Jazz and TBG for putting on a new generation of skilled beat makers. An absolutely ill listen from beginning to end. name: Karthala 72 - Diable Du Feu LP
description: Artist: Karthala 72 Title: Diable Du Feu Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM This is on some musical Heart of Darkness shit. A tuff and intense acid trip through a sonic desert of dirty distorted grooves. It's bizarre, it's seductive, it's freaky, it's nice. MP3 download card included. Slip this on the turntable and chill the fuck out like they do in Houston. Lovely. A1 - Tomorrow feat. E's E A2 - Break A3 - Sensation A4 - Stinger A5 - Heart Seed feat. Leah Alvarez & Martin Perna A6 - One B1 - Ten B2 - Interlude-Magical B3 - F Train To Church B4 - Brown Brother feat. Tim Ruiz B5 - Seconds B6 - Break Remix feat. Meghan Hendley LISTEN

description: Artist: Antibalas Title: Antibalas Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Antibalas back again with the original authenticity. Supremely talented musicians, producers and recording techniques make these guys the leaders in modern day Afro-Beat. A superb LP that deserves a proper listening. A1: Dirty Mooney A2: The Rat Catcher A3: Him Belly No Go Sweet B1: Ari Degeb B2: Ìbéjì B3: Sáré Kon Kon LISTEN

description: Artist: Super Hi-Fi Title: Dub To The Bone Format: LP Speed: 33 RPM Super Hi-Fi debut LP on Electric Cowbell features some of the band's original productions and remixes from Beverley Road All-Stars as well as Victor Rice and Subatomic Sound System. MP3 Download Card included. name: Dreamboat - Special Kiss EP
description: Artist: Dreamboat Title: Special Kiss Format: 12" EP Speed: 45 RPM Absolute Killer Modern-Day Boogie material from Miami's Cosmic Chronic label. 2 original slices of dance floor heat (plus a Tom Noble Remix) produced and composed by Mickey de Grand IV + EDG4R as Dreamboat. name: Tom Noble - Africa Bump
description: Artist: Tom Noble Title: Africa Bump Format: 12" Speed: 45 RPM Monster Afro-Disco heat from Tom Noble and PPU. This is a dance floor weapon, make no mistake. Gig bag staple if you don't know already. B-Side is an extended edit of the Superb's Party Together. Superb indeed. A1: Africa Bump (Tom Noble Edit) B1: Party Together (Tom Noble Edit) LISTEN

name: Monkey Robot EP
description: Artist: MonkeyRobot Title: The MonkeyRobot EP Format: 12" Speed: 45 RPM Debut release from Brussel-based production duo of Eric P and LuiGi runs the line from down to uptempo. These guys get busy with the beats. A1: Brick Stomach A2: Northern Lights B1: Rose Gris B2: Last Days LISTEN

name: Tyrone Evans / GRC - Rise Up
description: Artist: Various Title: Rise Up Format: 10" Speed: 45 RPM Monster Reggae Disco vibes from the Wackies vault, remastered and edited slightly for a well-deserved 10" discomix. Bumps much harder than the previously only available version on Tyrone Evans' LP. Greenwood Rhythm Coalition reshapes the original from scratch, adding a deft touch of musical flavors and influences from the Caribbean to West Africa and NYC. A1: Tyrone Evans - Rise Up B1: Greenwood Rhythm Coalition - Rise Up LISTEN

name: Bio Ritmo - Dina's Mambo
description: Artist: Bio Ritmo Title: Dina's Mambo Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Bio Ritmo has been patrolling the Salsa landscape for quite some time, developing their own unique style within the roots of Salsa Dura and this single is one of those perfect examples that blend traditional rhythms with tropical soundtrack influenced layers and textures. Dina's Mambo is an understated, funky slice of heaven on record. A1: Dina's Mambo B1: La Muralla LISTEN

name: Takuya Kuroda - Nocturnal Leaf
description: Artist: Takuya Kuroda Title: Nocturnal Leaf Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Up and coming trumpet player Takuya Kuroda teams with Marihito Ayabe on 2 refreshing but fresh, beat driven, jazzy compositions. Can't it all be so simple. Silkscreened Covers, Limited Edition of 300. A1: Nocturnal Leaf B1: Red Jungle LISTEN

name: Afro Kelenkye Band - Jungle Funk
description: Artist: Afro Kelenkye Band Title: Jungle Funk Format: Double 7" Speed: 45 RPM Supreme Afro-Funk out of Ghana! Voodoo Funk's Frank Gossner & Cultures Of Soul come together to produce this amazing double pack of never before released tracks from Afro Kelenkye Band. A1: Jungle Funk B1: Mother Africa C1: Munchin Session D1: Too Bad GIrl LISTEN

name: CSC Funk Band / Grant Phabao - Catcher's Mitt / Ogun
description: Artist: Various Title: Catcher's Mitt / Ogun Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Heavy duty split 45 release featuring Brooklyn's CSC Funk Band and Paris DJ's Grant Phabao Afrofunk Arkestra. A1: CSC Funk Band - Catcher's Mitt B1: Grant Phabao Afrofunk Arkestra - Ogun LISTEN

name: Aillacara 2743 - Cumbia Yerba Buena
description: Artist: Aillacara 2743 Title: Cumbia Yerba Buena Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Names You Can Trust presents the debut single from Aillacara 2743. A Chilean-French, Multi-Instrumentalist and turntablist, Aillacara 2743 cooks up two original Cumbias that build on the tradition of Andean, Amazonian, and Tropical rhythms with bass-heavy futurisitc beats and dusty, distrorted organs. A1: Cumbia Yerba Buena B1: Cumbia Chacarera LISTEN

name: Tom Noble & Max Rex - Relax Your Mind
description: Artist: Tom Noble & Max Rex Title: Relax Your Mind Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM More of the business from Tom Noble and drummer Max Rex on Liger Vision with the Funky bedroom jam. Relax Your Mind, it's '83. Flip Side rides the Oldsmobile Drum Machine to perfection, a slightly edited version from Tom Noble's In Liger Vision EP. A1: Tom Noble & Max Rex - Relax Your Mind B1: Tom Noble - Music Engine LISTEN

name: Antibalas - Dirty Money
description: Artist: Antibalas Title: Dirty Money Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Antibalas back again with the original authenticity. Supremely talented musicians, producers and recording techniques make these guys the leaders in modern day Afro-Beat. Lead single off of Antibalas' latest full length includes the masterful keyboard driven groove Dirty Money, plus the single only B-Side funker, A.W.O.L. A1: Dirty Money B1: A.W.O.L LISTEN

name: The Inversions - I Can't Stand These Lonely Nights
description: Artist: The Inversions featuring Bob & Gene Title: I Can't Stand These Lonely Nights Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM A sure fire Rock Steady vocal group throwback from the studios of Victor Axelrod & Daptone. Bob & Gene's vocal lay the mood on the front, while Victor crafts an impeccable organ dub inna Winston Wright style on the version-side, Rub The Lamp. A1: I Can't Stand These Lonely Nights B1: Rub The Lamp LISTEN

description: Artist: Nickodemus Title: A Tokyo Minute Format: 7" Blue Vinyl Speed: 45 RPM Nickodemus the world traveler with the Nippon no Rap. A1: A Tokyo Minute B1: Instrumental LISTEN

description: Artist: Potatohead People Title: Back To My Shit Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Vancouver production duo Potatohead People team up with Frank Nitt on the boom-bap love affair. A1: Back To My Shit feat. Frank Nitt B1: Love Hz LISTEN

name: Los Ribereños - Silbando + GRC Remix
description: Artist: Los Ribereños Title: Silbando Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Legendary Peruvian Chicha from Los Ribereños as reissued on Barbes' Roots of Chicha compilation. Proper 45 single with a bumped up remix version from NYCT's Greenwood Rhythm Coalition. Heat. A1: Silbando B1: Silbando (GRC Remix) LISTEN

name: Nickodemus - Give The Drummer Some
description: Artist: Nickodemus feat. The Real Live Show Title: Give The Drummer Some Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Wonderwheel staple Give The Drummer Some gets a rework from Dj Regal on a handy 45. A1: Give The Drummer Some (DJ Regal B-Boy Flip) B1: Instrumental LISTEN

name: Meridian Brothers - Eschuchen El Grito
description: Artist: Meridian Brothers Title: Escuchen El Grito Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Lead by Frente Cumbiero’s guitarist and engineer, Eblis Alvarez, the Meridian Brothers have been making waves on the Colombian music scene for quite some time. Their truly unique and experimental blend of Latin rhythms and Psychedelic grooves straddle the line between old and new. This 7-inch pressing presents 2 never before heard mixes from the Meridian Brothers IV album, a great introduction to those new to the group’s vast catalog and a secret weapon for your 45 box as well. A1: Escuchen el Grito Edit B1: Sostengan al Angel Instrumental LISTEN

name: Frente Cumbiero - Unconvention
description: Artist: Frente Cumbiero Title: Unconvention Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM After securing heavy rotation status with their debut single on Names You Can Trust, Frente Cumbiero triumphantly returns with their 2nd original single. Building upon their recent and rousing European and New York City tour in 2011, as well as the ongoing Ondatropica project with Quantic at the legendary Disco Fuentes studio in Medellín, this new single encapsulates the energy the group has developed as musicians and performers, as expressed in the rousing percussive, energy of the A-Side bomb Unconvention, to the synth-bass driven, psychedelic trip of B-Side Ika. A perfect blend of Colombian roots rhythms and modern, inventive composition and instrumentation that’ll have bodies shaking and heads turning – another strong reminder that Frente Cumbiero is quickly becoming the leader in the Cumbia Nueva movement. A1: Unconvention B1: Ika LISTEN

name: Greenwood Rhythm Coalition - Cumbia Kikuchi
description: Artist: Greenwood Rhythm Coalition Title: Cumbia Kikuchi Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Greenwood Rhythm Coalition is back with a couple of low-slung tropical bubblers aimed straight at your summer barbecues and block parties. Cumbia Kikuchi crackles with a hypnotic horn line and pawn shop synths, chugging along relentlessly like a Peruvian space cowboy on mellow coca leaves. Regresar A Cali nods to lowriding funksters in both the Colombian city and its American namesake a bit further up the Pacific coast, playing kinda ruff with a Zapp-esque synbass that tangles with tropical guitar and percussion. A1: Cumbia Kikuchi B1: Regresar a Cali LISTEN

name: Midnight Lab Band - Laser Tag
description: Artist: Midnight Lab Band Title: Laser Tag Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM Another sleeper single from Midnight Lab Band. Lush lo-fi productions with influences from early dance music and suburban basement 80's funk. Last bit of stock left from NYCT. A1: Laser Tag B1: Don's Demo LISTEN

name: Doctor Stereo - La Cumbia Perdida
description: Artist: Doctor Stereo Title: La Cumbia Perdida Format: 7" Speed: 45 RPM A swinging summertime heatrock. La Cumbia Perdida is an exploration into early 1960s Cumbia roots, full of irresistible hip hugging piano licks against a contemporary backbone of heavy drums and squelchy synthesized effects. DJ Tahira shifts the original track ever so slightly into Afro-Colombian territory, subtly adding a layer of quintessential Afro-Beat inspired guitar licks and a deft touch of deep subterranean bass. A1: La Cumbia Perdida (Doctor Stereo's Original) B1: La Cumbia Perdida (Tahira's Afro-Cumbia Remix) LISTEN
